title: How to Make Coconut Milk from Coconut Cream

steps.headline: Purchase or take out the coconut cream can.
Open the can and pour the coconut cream into two bowls.
steps.description: Make sure to include an even amount of coconut cream in each bowl.

steps.headline: Add water to each bowl.
steps.description: The amount will depend on the consistency you want. It's best to add small amounts and build up rather than to overdo it.

steps.headline: Mix the coconut cream and water together thoroughly.
steps.description: The consistency should be smooth and look like - coconut milk!

steps.headline: Use or store.
steps.description: If storing, pour into a suitable storage container or jar and refrigerate (such as a glass jug or bowl with lid). Don't keep it longer than a few more days though or it will go off.

steps.headline: Choose a suitable coconut cream.
steps.description: You can make this by the cup or by the quart.

steps.headline: Open the can.
steps.description: Pour the coconut cream into two bowls, in even amounts.

steps.headline: Add coconut water to each bowl.
steps.description: Mix it at the ratio of about 1 ounce of coconut cream to either 7 or 8 ounces of packaged coconut water.

steps.headline: Stir vigorously or shake.
steps.description: You now have coconut milk made at home.

steps.headline: Use or store.
steps.description: Refrigerate if storing, or follow the freezer method in the Tips.
